file_content.text: My lord--don't mind my saying so, but you picked the right time to show up.
Great work with the jaggalors. We'll move advance units out within the hour.
The jaggalors are dead. You've got nothing to worry about.
I took care of the jaggalors.
Well, well. Looks like our advance is back on track.
And one of the rarest species of Corellian wildlife is dead. Excuse me if I don't celebrate.
Don't mind him. He's just a sore loser. As far as I'm concerned, you've done a great thing.
A little respect might lengthen that life of yours.
Watch your mouth, zookeeper.
Yes, of course. My deepest apologies. I was only upset... Please, forgive me.
Civilians--don't know when to shut up. Anyway, thanks for your help. I'll get the advance moving again within the hour.
I used the compound on the jaggalors. They're the Republic's problem now.
I still think killing 'em would've been easier. But it'll be nice to see those Republic boys on the menu for a change.
Thank you for not harming them. When this planet finds peace again, those creatures will be the pride of Corellia once more.
Press on with your advance, Lieutenant. Victory awaits.
Glad to do my part.
Absolutely. We'll be sending out lead units within the hour.
I expect to get the credit.
Absolutely. We couldn't have done it without you.
If you've finished celebrating, why don't you get back to killing Republic soldiers.
Enough back-slapping.
Of course. I'll deploy advance units right away.
We can't advance our position till those jaggalors are taken care of.
You're a good little collaborator, so I heard you out. But you tell me how to do my job again, I'll bleed you.
Please--I'm sorry. I'm only asking you not to hunt and kill these creatures.
Hunter, you're just the kind of professional I need.
Sir. Finally, someone who can get this done.
Well... Just the kind of professionals I need.
The Republic's turned loose a bunch of jaggalors from the Coronet zoo. We're getting torn to shreds trying to advance through the area.
The Empire halts for no man or creature. An Imperial lieutenant should know this.
We do not bow to animals.
Of course, my lord. Which is why I'm looking for help with these jaggalors.
How clever of them. Fortunately, clever plans can be undone.
A shrewd strategy.
That's where I'm hoping you can help, my lord. These jaggalors....
Hunting's what I get paid for.
Sounds like open season.
Pay's no problem, long as you take care of this jaggalor predicament.
The Empire can't afford delays. What's your plan?
The advance has to continue.
I think it's one you'll appreciate, agent. These jaggalors....
Sounds like there's some disagreement on how to handle things.
Why the bickering?
Ignore him. He doesn't have a battalion of men getting torn apart. These jaggalors....
I'm trying to remember the last time I heard an excuse this pitiful.
Zoo animals? Pathetic.
Hey, if I'd never seen a jaggalor I'd say the same thing.
They're Corellian predators. Powerful, extremely aggressive. Last squad they attacked, we found pieces spread over two klicks. I need them put down.
These are rare and graceful predators. The kings of Corellian wildlife. Yes, the Empire's advance must continue, but please--don't exterminate the jaggalors.
We haven't been introduced.
Who exactly are you?
He's a zoo administrator. He's been working with the occupation so I said I'd hear him out. Doesn't know when to shut up.
That's a lot of flattery for creatures doing so much damage.
You're defending these things?
I'm only saying they're animals acting on instinct. They don't mean harm to the Empire.
You're not serious...
I hope I haven't offended. I'm just suggesting there's a way to free up your advance without hurting them.
Please--the zoo has a pheromone compound for managing jaggalor aggression. You can redirect their hostility at their Republic handlers. Same result, no killing.
You kill 'em, you know they're neutralized. No surprises.
The way to deal with an unruly animal is to put it down.
I'll kill the jaggalors.
I think I'm going to be sick.
Simple solutions are good solutions. Good hunting.
No sense killing them if we can turn them against the Republic.
I'll use the compound.
You won't regret this. Here's the compound. Treat the jaggalors with it, and I'll treat the lieutenant's men.
To the jaggalors, we'll smell like pack-mates, and the Republic handlers will smell threatening.
Don't mean to be rude, but I've got a lot on my plate right now. Excuse me.
